datafield.subfield: The two volumes of the New Shakspere society, 'Shakespeare's centurie of prayse,' (2d ed., 1879,) and 'Some 300 fresh allusions to Shakspere,' from 1594 to 1694 (1886), bound together.
Pub. for the New Shakspere society, by N. Trübner & co.,
Each volume has special t.-p. and separate pagination.
"Centurie of prayse" ed. by C. M. Ingliby (2d edition by Miss L. T. Smith); "Some 300 fresh allusions" ed. by F. J. Furnivall.
a collection of allusions to Shakspere from 1591 to 1700 ...
a collection of allusions to Shakspere from 1591 to 1700.

Originally compiled by C. M. Ingleby, L. Toulmin Smith, and F. J. Furnivall, with the assistance of the New Shakspere Society: re-edited, rev., and re-arr., with an introd., by John Munro (1909), and now re-issued with a pref. by Sir Edmund Chambers.
Library of Shakespearean biography and criticism,
a collection of allusions to Shakspere from 1591 to 1700.

Originally compiled by C. M. Ingleby, Miss L. Toulmin Smith, and Dr. F. J. Furnivall, with the assistance of the New Shakspere Society: re-edited, rev., and re-arr., with an introd., by John Munro (1909), and now re-issued with a pref. by Sir Edmund Chambers.
The Shakespeare library. General editor, Professor I. Gollancz. [iv. Shakespeare's England]
the plays performed by the crafts or mysteries of York, on the day of Corpus Christi in the 14th, 15th, and 16th centuries.
Edited with introd. and glossary by Lucy Toulmin Smith.
First published 1885 from ms. 137 in the library of Lord Ashburnham.

The creation, Fall of Lucifer / The Barkers -- The creation to the fifth day / Playsterers -- God creates Adam and Eve / Cardmakers -- Adam and Eve in the Garden of Eden / Fullers -- Man's disobedience and Fall / Cowpers - Adam and Eve driven from Eden / Armourers - Sacrificium Cayme et Abell / Gloveres -- Building of the ark / Shipwrites -- Noah and the flood / Fysshers and Marynars -- Abraham's sacrifice / Parchmyners and Bokebynders -- The Israelites in Egypt, the ten plagues, and passage of the Red Sea / The Hoseers -- Annunciation, and visit of Elizabeth to Mary / Spicers -- Joseph's trouble about Mary / Pewtereres and Foundours -- Journey to Bethlehem; Birth of Jesus / Tille-thekers -- The angels and the shepherds / Chaundelers -- Coming of the three kings to Herod / Masonns -- Coming of the three kings, the adoration / Goldsmyths --

Flight into Egypt / Marchallis -- Massacre of the innocents / Gyrdillers and Naylers -- Christ with the doctors in the temple / Sporiers and Lorimers -- Baptism of Jesus / Barbours -- Temptation of Jesus / Smythis -- The Transfiguration / Coriours -- Woman taken in adultery. Raising of Lazarous / Cappemakers -- Entry into Jerusalem / Skynners -- Conspiracy to take Jesus / Cutteierers -- The Last Supper / Baxteres -- The agony and betrayal / Cordewaners -- Peter denies Jesus: Jesus examined by Caiaphas / Bowers and Flecchers -- Dream of Pilate's wife: Jesus before Pilate / Tapiteres and Couchers -- Trial before Herod / Lytsteres -- Second accusation before Pilate: Remorse of Judas: Purchase of Field of Blood / Cokis and Waterlederes -- Second trial continued: Judgment on Jesus / Tyllemakers -- Christ led up to Calvary / Shermen.

Crucifixio Christi / Pynneres and Paynters -- Mortificacio Christi / Bocheres -- Harrowing of Hell / Sadilleres -- Resurrection: Fright of the Jews / Carpenteres -- Jesus appears to Mary Magdalene after the resurrection / Wyne-drawers -- Travellers to Emmaus / The sledmen -- Purification of Mary: Simeon and Anna prophesy / Hatmakers, Masons and laborers -- Incredulity of Thomas / Escreueneres -- The Ascension / Tailoures -- Descent of the Holy Spirit / Potteres -- The death of Mary / Draperes -- Appearance of our Lady to Thomas / Wefferes -- Assumption and coronation of the virgin / Osteleres -- The Judgment Day / Merceres -- Coronation of our Lady / Inholders.
the plays performed by the crafts or mysteries of York on the day of Corpus Christi in the 14th, 15th, and 16th centuries;
now first printed from the unique manuscript in the Library of Lord Ashburnham, ed. with introduction and glossary by Lucy Toulmin Smith ...
lxxviii p., 1 l., 557 p. incl. 3 pl. (music) 3 fold. facsim. (music, incl. front.)
being materials for a history of opinion on Shakespeare and his works, A.D. 1591-1693.
Pub. for the New Shakspere society, by N. Trübner & co.,
"Notices of Shakespere or his works, direct or implied, to be found in print or in manuscript within the hundred years from 1592 to 1693."

by J.J. Jusserand, tr. from the French by Lucy Toulmin Smith.
rev. and enl. by the author.

by J. J. Jusserand ... tr. from the French by Lucy Toulmin Smith.
"The author has profited by the occasion afforded him by this translation to revise the text of his book (which appeared in 1884), and to add about a fourth of new matter."--Pref.

by J. J. Jusserand; translated from the French by Lucy Toulmin Smith.

The itinerary in Wales of John Leland in or about the years 1536-1539;
The itinerary of John Leland in or about the years 1535-1543,
Half-title of v. 1-2 and 4-5: Leland's Itinerary in England and Wales. Half-title of v. 3, which is part 6: Leland's Itinerary in Wales.
"Comparative table of the MSS. and editions": v. 1, p. [xxxvi]

[v. 1] Parts 1 to 3. 1907.--[v. 2] Parts 4 and 5. 1908.--[v. 3][Part 6] Itinerary in Wales, extracted from his MSS. arranged and edited ... 1906.--[v. 4] Parts 7 and 8, with appendices including extracts from Leland's Collectanea. 1909.--[v. 5] Parts 9 to 11, with two appendices, a glossary, and general index. 1910.
The itinerary of John Leland in or about the years 1535-1543.
Edited by Lucy Toulmin Smith. With a foreword by Thomas Kendrick.
Half-title of v. 1-2 and 4-5: Leland's Itinerary in England and Wales. Half-title of v. 3, which is part VI: Leland's Itinerary in Wales.

The original ordinances of more than one hundred early English gilds: Together with þe olde vsages of þe cite of Wynchester; the Ordinances of Worcester; the Office of the mayor of Bristol; and the Costomary of the manor of Tettenhall-Regis. From original mss. of the fourteenth and fifteenth centuries.

Ed., with notes, by the late Toulmin Smith ... With an introduction and glossary, &c., by his daughter, Lucy Toulmin Smith. And a preliminary essay ... On the history and development of gilds, by Lujo Brentano ...
Pub. for the Early English Text Society, by N. Trübner & Co.,
"Additions and corrections" (1 leaf) inserted after t.-p.

The original ordinances of more than one hundred early English gilds: Together with þe olde vsages of þe cite of Wynchestre; the Ordinances of Worcester; the Office of the mayor of Bristol; and the Costomary of the manor of Tettenhall-Regis. From original mss. of the fourteenth and fifteenth centuries.

Edited, with notes, by the late Toulmin Smith... With an introduction and glossary, &c., by his daughter, Lucy Toulmin Smith. And a preliminary essay... On the history and development of gilds, by Lujo Brentano.
Pub. for the Early English text society, by N. Trübner & co.,
Early English text society. Publications. Original series.

A manual of the English grammar and language for self-help.
